intro: Eminia, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Eminia thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its vibrant color and compact growth habit.
